newsitem.title: USA: Computervision sees Q1 oper losses.
newsitem.headline: Computervision sees Q1 oper losses.

text.p: Computervision Corp said Wednesday that its operating losses will be substantially larger than expected for the first quarter ended March 31, 1997.
The increased losses relates to a shortfall of about $20 million in software license revenue, the company said.
For last year's first quarter, Computervision reported a profit of $0.13 per share.

The company said it did not close between 10 to 15 orders before the end of the first quarter that resulted in the shortfall and highlighted the company's continuing dependence on closing contracts in the final days of a quarter.
These orders are still in process and have not been lost to competition, the company said.
While the company said it believes it will be able to close these deals in coming quarters, no assurances can be given that it will be able to do so.
The company also said that because of the loss it will not meet certain financial covenants in its credit facility, under which there are no existing borrowings.
Computervision said it will report final results for the first quarter on April 24.
